title: Aloo Paratha
instructions: Boil the potatoes and mash them. In a bowl, mix mashed potatoes with cumin seeds, chopped green chilies, ginger, coriander, and salt. Prepare dough by kneading wheat flour with water and a pinch of salt. Roll out dough into circles, stuff with the potato mixture, and seal. Roll again gently into a paratha and cook on a heated griddle, applying ghee on both sides until golden brown.

title: Poha
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds. Once they splutter, add chopped onions, green chilies, and peanuts, and sauté. Add turmeric and salt. Stir in the flattened rice and cook for a few minutes. Garnish with coriander leaves and squeeze lemon juice on top. Serve warm.

title: Chole Bhature
instructions: Soak chickpeas overnight and boil until soft. Prepare the dough for bhature by mixing flour, yogurt, salt, and a pinch of baking soda. Roll into small balls and deep fry until puffed. For the chole, sauté onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. Add boiled chickpeas and simmer for 20 minutes. Serve hot with bhature.

title: Masoor Dal
instructions: Rinse lentils and cook them with water, turmeric, and salt. In a pan, heat ghee and add cumin seeds, chopped onion, garlic, and tomatoes. Sauté until golden, then add this tempering to the cooked lentils. Simmer for 10 minutes. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve with rice or roti.

title: Paneer Butter Masala
instructions: Sauté onions and ginger-garlic paste in butter. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. Add spices like garam masala, turmeric, and chili powder. Once the tomatoes blend into a smooth gravy, add paneer cubes and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in cream and simmer for another 5 minutes. Serve with naan or rice.

title: Dosa
instructions: Soak rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds overnight. Grind them together into a smooth batter and let it ferment for 8-10 hours. Heat a non-stick pan, grease with oil, and pour a thin layer of batter. Cook until golden and crispy. Serve with coconut chutney and sambar.

title: Methi Thepla
instructions: In a bowl, mix wheat flour, cumin seeds, chili powder, turmeric, and chopped fenugreek leaves. Add water to form a dough. Roll out small portions of dough into thin circles and cook on a griddle, applying ghee on both sides. Serve with yogurt or pickle.

title: Samosa
instructions: Boil potatoes and mash them. In a pan, sauté onions, garlic, ginger, and spices like cumin, coriander, and garam masala. Add peas and cook for a few minutes. Stuff the mixture in samosa wrappers and deep fry until golden. Serve with mint chutney.

title: Pav Bhaji
instructions: Boil potatoes, peas, and cauliflower. In a pan, sauté onions, tomatoes, bell pepper, and spices. Add the boiled vegetables and mash them into a thick consistency. Stir in pav bhaji masala and cook for 10 minutes. Serve with buttered pav rolls.

title: Biryani
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices for 2 hours. Cook rice with whole spices until 70% done. In a pan, sauté onions and cook the marinated chicken. Layer the cooked chicken with rice and cook on low heat for 15 minutes. Garnish with mint and coriander. Serve with raita.

title: Idli
instructions: Soak rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds overnight. Grind them into a smooth batter and let it ferment for 8-12 hours. Grease idli molds and pour the batter into each mold. Steam for 10-15 minutes. Serve hot with chutney and sambar.

title: Upma
instructions: In a pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds, curry leaves, chopped onions, green chilies, and ginger. Add semolina and roast it lightly. Gradually add water and cook until the upma thickens. Garnish with roasted cashews and serve hot.

title: Kadhi Pakora
instructions: Make pakoras by mixing gram flour, water, onions, chili powder, and salt. Deep fry small balls of the batter. For kadhi, whisk yogurt and gram flour in water to make a smooth batter. Boil it in a pan and add the fried pakoras. Simmer for 15 minutes and garnish with coriander leaves.

title: Aloo Gobi
instructions: Sauté onions and tomatoes in oil. Add chopped potatoes and cauliflower, along with spices. Cook until tender, adding water if necessary. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve with roti or rice.

title: Tandoori Chicken
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, spices, and lemon juice. Let it sit for 2-3 hours. Grill the chicken in a preheated oven at 180°C for 25-30 minutes. Serve with onion rings and naan.

title: Vada Pav
instructions: Boil and mash potatoes. Make a spicy mixture with chili powder, coriander, and spices. Shape into patties and fry until golden. Serve the vada in a pav bun with garlic chutney and fried green chilies.

title: Dhokla
instructions: Mix gram flour, yogurt, turmeric, and water to make a smooth batter. Pour into a greased steamer and steam for 20 minutes. Prepare tempering with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and sugar, and pour over the steamed dhokla. Cut into pieces and serve.

title: Rajma
instructions: Soak kidney beans overnight and cook until soft. Sauté onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, and spices in a pan. Add the cooked beans and simmer for 15 minutes. Serve with rice or roti.

title: Bhindi Masala
instructions: Sauté chopped onions and tomatoes in oil. Add chopped okra and cook on medium heat until tender. Add chili powder, garam masala, and coriander leaves. Stir well and cook for 5 minutes. Serve with roti.

title: Momos
instructions: Make dough by mixing all-purpose flour and water. Prepare the filling with finely chopped cabbage, carrots, ginger, garlic, and soy sauce. Stuff the dough with the filling, shape into small dumplings, and steam for 15 minutes. Serve with chili sauce.
